poem:
"Volunteering at Summer's Troubadour"

Beneath summer's bounty, populous tents rise,
Bartered work for passage, mirth in disguise.
Earn your keep, steward in reveler's guise,
Free the music, let kindness arise. 

Breaking barrier of commerce, a fellowship grows,
In Oxfam's shadow, generosity sows.
A food token, given without throes,
Feeding the soul as the festival glows.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Borrow a tent and bring food: how to cut the cost of UK summer music festivals Volunteer to get free passes You can get into festivals for free by offering to work during the event. Websites such as Festaff offer easy ways to volunteer for roles such as stewarding. Oxfam, which often has a campaigning presence at festivals, also sells goods in shops. Volunteer and you can get crew camping, a meal voucher for every". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
